reviewText: A mystery movie that bears repeated viewing, and will be sure to at least leave you debating it's conclusion for days afterward. One of the best things about independent cinema is that this is not a traditional whodunnit, but is a mystery nonetheless. It is also refreshing to have a mystery set very muchly in contemporary times, minus exotic commuter trains and monocles. It is given 5 stars exactly because it elicits feelings that could be construed as frustration.
